text: hi everyone
big thingy dog tano here the internet's
busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
spectral wound
project a diabolic thirst spectral
wound montreal metal outfit this is
their third full-length lp over here
their first
big outing for profound lore records i
was mildly impressed by the sound of
their last album
i saw even more heads being turned by
the release of this new one so i decided
to
take a dive and after having done so i
can certainly understand why this is
gaining the traction that it has
as far as black metal is concerned a
diabolic thirst is one of the most
monstrous releases i've heard this year
the sound on this thing
is impressive it's dense it's distorted
and packed with just enough atmosphere
to make it feel like it's
towering over you not only that but
every song here is performed with an
incredible amount of guts these blast
beats and fills are
the spiked demonic backbone to
this hellish record they punch through
with strong grooves no matter
how many deafening layers of vocals or
guitar are thrown on top
and not just to give it to the drums
because every element of the band sound
on this project is
pushing it to the extreme to the point
where sometimes their ideas can get a
little lost in translation
take the closer for example the last
third of this cut
is so overpowering and so chaotic so
messy
the guitars and vocals just gruesomely
bleeding into each other like
two respective wildfires meeting at a
midpoint
to create some kind of giant super fire
which i suppose is fitting considering
the opener on
this lp kicks off with what sounds like
a crackling fire
just before some completely unforgiving
rips on the opener hit
the ferocity this band approaches every
track here with is really something to
behold
rarely does this record let up or give
the listener any room to breathe in its
40-minute run time
safe to say a diabolic thirst is pretty
no i mean
occasionally you may get another guitar
layer thrown into there just for
another touch of melody and there is
that somewhat overwhelming atmosphere i
talked about earlier
but look there are much more atmospheric
and melodic black metal records out
there
i guess what i'm trying to say is when
it comes to this genre's most
classic and tried-and-true sonic and
compositional forms this band plays it
pretty straight
there is not much room for anything in
terms of experimentation or adventure on
this lp
i mean even the cover looks like
something straight out of norway in the
so to put this lp in a nutshell much of
it does run like a classic
black metal record but it's presented
with a recording that
is much punchier heavier more high def
performances that are ultra tight and
aggressive
now the simple approach does have its
pros and cons
the good is that we have a savage
merciless black metal record here
that does a pretty good job of
celebrating and embodying the sounds and
ideas that
made those records from way back in the
day as compelling as they are
but the downside to this is that the
band takes a painfully
basic compositional approach to a lot of
these tracks
which is disappointing for a few reasons
not only because as the listener i just
find it a little tedious
but also the really good performances
across this lp signal the band is
capable of so much more
i mean don't get me wrong i love how
intense and explosive the
sound and performances of this lp are
but what is absolutely not edge of your
seat are
the same chord progressions and
tremolo melodies that i've heard on
dozens of other black metal records in
the past
and look this is not a plea for the band
to
drift away from the black metal sound by
all means
stick to it you're obviously very good
at it but that doesn't change that
the chords and melodies written
throughout this project are just
really uninspired souring the mood of
tracks like frigid and spellbound
because even if the sound of this track
is killer i'm just let down by how
unimaginative the riffs are
outside of a few moments there's just
very little in the way of compositional
ambition to be found here
now look ultimately that does not make
this
a bad record a terrible record i
still see the merit in it and i still
see why it's getting the attention that
it is
plus you know i generally like it myself
but the plain chords and melodies laced
throughout this project can only take it
so far even if i find
other aspects of it impressive and with
there being only six songs stretching
across
this record's 40 minute run time it's
pretty easy to get a quick sense of just
how basic some of the riffing here is
all that being said though i think the
record starts off with a lot of fire in
its belly and it does have a strong
chaotic powerful finisher but everything
else
in the middle of these two spots is
just fine feeling a decent six
on this one tran position have you given
this record a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should
i review next hit the like if you like
please subscribe and please don't cry
hit the bell as well
over here next to my head it's another
video that you can check out hit that up
worthy link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano spectral wound
forever
